titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the Humberto Dionisio Papers, 1919-1990, in the Archives of American Art AAA.dionhumb
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Stephanie L. Ashley

note.p: This finding aid was created from a MARC collection-level record. 216215

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-07-20T10:52-0400

did.abstract: The papers of painter Humberto Dionisio measure 2.6 linear feet and date from 1919 to 1990. The collection primarily documents Dionisio's relationships with his family, particularly his mother, through letters, photographs, financial records, printed material, and family memorabilia collected by Dionisio himself and by his mother, Zaida Ortega Dominguez.
did.langmaterial: The records are in English and Spanish.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Humberto Dionisio was born in Cuba in 1950. During the 1970s he became a noted poster artist and completed his studies in Graphic Design at the Consejo Nacional de Cultura in Cuba in 1975. He arrived in Miami, Florida, via the Mariel boat lift in 1980, and achieved success in Miami as a painter from the mid to late 1980s. He died in March 1987 at the age of thirty-six.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection measures 2.6 linear feet, dates from 1919 to 1990, and includes letters, photographs, financial records, printed material, and family memorabilia. The papers of Dionisio primarily document his relationships with other family members and friends through photographs and letters received from his mother, Zaida Ortega Dominguez, and others. The collection also contains papers, photographs and original sketches (by Dominguez) collected by Dominguez herself which were in Dionisio's care. Papers relating specifically to Dionisio's work as an artist are represented to a lesser degree in this collection and consist primarily of printed material and photographs of Dionisio at work and at an exhibition of his work. There is also one original watercolor by Dionisio from 1985.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into two series. Each series is arranged into subseries according to record type.

list.item: Series 1: Humberto Dionisio Papers, 1926-1990, undated (Boxes 1-3; 1.7 linear feet)
Series 2: Zaida Ortega Dominguez Papers, 1919-circa 1980s, undated (Boxes 4-6; 0.9 linear feet)

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Humberto Dionisio papers were donated by Jim Kitchens, a friend of Dionisio, in 1996.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research. Use requires an appointment and is limited to the Washington, D.C. research facility.

userestrict.head: Ownership and Literary Rights
userestrict.p: The Humberto Dionisio papers are owned by the Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution. Literary rights as possessed by the donor have been dedicated to public use for research, study, and scholarship. The collection is subject to all copyright laws.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Humberto Dionisio papers, 1919-1990. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed by Rosa M. Fernández in 1997.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The bulk of this series consists of letters and photographs. Letters are primarily from Dionisio's mother, Zaida Ortega Dominguez, and are generally in Spanish.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p:
The series is arranged into eight subseries.
1.1: Biographical Material, 1974-1987, undated
1.2: Letters, 1980-1987, undated
1.3: Business Papers, 1980-1986
1.4: Notes, undated
1.5: Writings, 1978-1980, undated
1.6: Clippings, 1975-1990, undated
1.7: Photographs, 1950-1984, undated
1.8: Michael Ford File, 1926, 1951, 1987-1990, undated

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The biographical material found in this subseries consists primarily of the contents of two wallets, including photographs of Dionisio and family members and identification cards. The subseries also contains diplomas and awards, a resumé, and financial and medical records.

did.unittitle: St. Kevins Catholic School, Dade County Public School

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In addition to letters from Dionisio's mother, this subseries also contains letters from his grandmother, Nelia Dominguez Saavedra, and his cousin, dancer Zoraida Rodriguez, which were written between Dionisio's departure from Cuba in 1980 and his death in 1987. The letters frequently mention social and political events in Cuba and the envelopes are often decorated with colorful pictures of Cuban writers and political heroes, as well as fauna and flora of the island. Several letters include clippings from Cuban newspapers regarding art exhibitions and films. Letters from Zoraida Rodriguez include clippings and programs of the "Ballet de Camaguey" in which she was one of the principal dancers. Also found here are letters from Zaida Ortega Dominguez addressed to other family members living in Miami. Three letters from Dominguez to Dionisio, dated 1987, were received unopened.

did.unittitle: Letters from Friends and Other Family

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains routine business and legal records.

did.unittitle: State of Florida Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains guest and price lists for several exhibitions of Dionisio's work, including a 1990 retrospective exhibition at the InterAmerican Art Gallery. Handwritten notes, and lists of names and addresses can also be found here.

did.unittitle: Guest Lists for Axes and Retrospective
Price Lists and Lists of Works in Humberto Dionisio Retrospective

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains several poems in addition to an essay by Giulio V. Blanc about Dionisio.

did.unittitle: Writings by Giulio V. Blanc About Humberto Dionisio and the Expresiónes Hispanas Exhibition
Poems by Dionisio, for Dioniso, and for Damian by Carlos Manuel Ortego

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here are clippings about Dionisio and other artists, exhibition announcements and catalogs, and handwritten and printed versions of a eulogy written for Dionisio by Carlos Alfonzo.

did.unittitle: Exhibition Announcements for Group Shows with Dionisio

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In addition to loose photographs of Dionisio with family and friends, this subseries contains two photograph albums of snapshots of Dionisio with family and friends, in addition to photographs of Dionisio at work, and at an exhibition of his work.

did.unittitle: Photographs of Dionisio and Immediate Family
Photographs of Dionisio Alone and with Friends and Family
Photographs of Dionisio as a Child

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of a small amount of material kept by Michael Ford, a friend of Dionisio, including correspondence, photocopies of artwork, an original watercolor by Dioniso, and printed material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Papers of Dioniso's mother primarily consist of photographs of family and friends in addition to family memorabilia, artwork by Dominguez, letters, and printed material. Certain items relate to Dionisio's brother, Ricardo Padron Ortega, and his father, Humberto Ysidro Padron Fernández.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here are family records such as birth and marriage certificates and baby memorabilia.

did.unittitle: Ricardo Padron Ortega Funeral Document and Doctor's Certificate
First Communion Certificate of Ricardo Padron Ortega
Lock of Hair with Handwritten Note
Humberto Ysidro Padron Fernández Birth Certificate

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here are poems, greeting and sympathy cards, notes, and a clipping.

did.unittitle: Poem from Ricardo Padron Ortega to Dominguez
Sympathy Card from Friends to Dominguez upon the Death of Ricardo Padron Ortega
Handwritten Notes from Ricardo Padron Ortega to Dominguez
Clipping Concerning Bridal Shower of Friend

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries forms the bulk of the series and contains photographs of family and friends including Dionisio as an infant and throughout his life.

did.unittitle: Photographs of Family and Friends, Group Shots
Photographs of Children, Family and Friends
Photographs of Dominguez and Humberto Ysidro Padron Fernández (Husband)
Photographs of Dionisio's Brothers as Children
Photographs of Dominguez with Second Husband
Photographs of Baptism, Wedding, Bridal Shower and Dinner Banquet
Photographs of Dominguez and Unidentified Woman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of a group of original sketches and drawings by Dominguez, primarily of Hollywood personalities.
